name: default-mode network
function: It is a resting state network of structures that are more active when someone is not engaged attentionally.
other: posterior-inferior parietal lobule (angular gyrus): Both in paper, used angular gyrus

name: task-positive network
function: Increased activity while completing task. The rate of increase may vary with tasks.
other: A lot of odd things that probably make this not very accurate....

name: mesolimbic dopamine system
function: Activated in response to natural rewards (food, sex, social interaction, etc.)
other: It sounded like this was one of many reward pathways

name: hate circuit
function: Active when an individual viewed a face of a person whom they hate. Activity in certian areas varied with intensity of hate.
other: Removed a lot of right and bilateral distinctions...

name: sexual preference
function: Structures involved in deciding preferred sexual activities or types of sexual partners

name: present moment pathway
function: These structures are active when individuals are practicing mindfullness.

name: serotonergic raphe nuclei
function: excitatory and inhibitory, active during arousal, mood regulation

name: Noradrenergic Locus Coeruleus
function: excitatory and inhibitory, active during arousal

name: Dopaminergic Ventral Tegmental Nuclei
function: excitatory and inhibitory, active during arousal, mood regulation, reinforcement/reward

name: Cholinergic Nuclei
function: excitatory and inhibitory, active during arousal, learning, attention

name: visual module
other: The visual module covers the entire span of the visua cortex and includes both primary and secondary corticies. What are those primary and secondary corticies listed out?

name: basal ganglia module
other: 'Putamen, and thalamus. It also extended into the medial temporal lobe, temporal pole, parahippocampal gyrus, hippocampus, amygdala and cerebellum. Interestingly, these brain regions have not been consistently classified into one component by ICA.'
